what: Conditional Inference Trees for Survival — conditionalinference
title: Conditional Inference Trees for Survival — conditionalinference
text: Conditional Inference Trees survival analysis using unbiased recursive partitioning. method addresses variable selection bias inherent traditional CART employing conditional inference procedures. algorithm separates variable selection splitting point selection, providing unbiased tree structures particularly valuable survival data mixed-type predictors complex censoring patterns. Features include statistical significance-based stopping criteria, handling  missing values without surrogate splits, robust performance correlated predictors. method particularly suitable exploratory survival analysis biomarker discovery clinical research.

title: Conditional Inference Trees for Survival — conditionalinference
code: conditionalinference(   data,   time,   event,   predictors,   strata,   teststat = "quad",   testtype = "Bonferroni",   mincriterion = 0.95,   minsplit = 20,   minbucket = 7,   maxdepth = 5,   nresample = 9999,   logrank_scores = TRUE,   show_splits = TRUE,   show_nodes = TRUE,   show_importance = TRUE,   plot_tree = TRUE,   plot_survival = TRUE,   plot_importance = FALSE,   mtry,   replace = FALSE,   subset )

title: Conditional Inference Trees for Survival — conditionalinference
text: data data data frame. time Time event variable (numeric). right-censored data,  time study entry event censoring. event Event indicator variable. survival analysis: 0 = censored, 1 = event. competing risks: 0 = censored, 1+ = different event types. predictors Variables use tree construction. Can include numeric,  ordinal, nominal variables. algorithm handles mixed-type predictors optimally. strata Optional stratification variable stratified survival analysis. Creates separate baseline hazards stratum. teststat Test statistic use. 'quad' uses quadratic form multivariate tests, 'max' uses maximum-type statistic. Quadratic form powerful small effects, maximum-type large effects. testtype Multiple testing correction method. Bonferroni provides conservative reliable correction. Monte Carlo uses permutation-based p-values. mincriterion Minimum criterion (1 - p-value) variable selection. Higher values create conservative trees fewer splits. Default 0.95 corresponds significance level 0.05. minsplit Minimum number observations required node splitting. Higher values create simpler trees reduce overfitting. minbucket Minimum number observations terminal nodes. smaller minsplit. Higher values increase tree stability. maxdepth Maximum depth tree. Controls tree complexity prevents overfitting. Deeper trees may overfit, shallower trees may underfit. nresample Number Monte Carlo resamples p-value computation using Monte Carlo test type. resamples provide accurate p-values increase computation time. logrank_scores Use log-rank scores survival splitting. TRUE, uses log-rank statistics optimized survival data. FALSE, uses standard conditional inference. show_splits Display detailed split statistics including test statistics, p-values, variable importance measures. show_nodes Display detailed information terminal node including Kaplan-Meier estimates, risk tables, survival summaries. show_importance Calculate display variable importance measures based improvement prediction accuracy. plot_tree Generate tree structure plot nodes, splits, survival curves. plot_survival Plot Kaplan-Meier survival curves terminal node confidence intervals risk tables. plot_importance Generate variable importance plot showing relative importance predictors tree construction. mtry Number variables randomly selected split. Leave empty use variables. Setting creates random forest-like approach. replace Use bootstrap sampling replacement tree construction. Creates robust trees may reduce interpretability. subset Fraction observations use tree construction. Leave empty use observations. Useful large datasets.

title: Conditional Survival Estimation — conditionalsurvival
text: Performs conditional survival estimation, calculates probability surviving beyond specific time point given survival conditioning time point. analysis particularly useful updating prognosis estimates patients already survived certain period. Multiple estimation methods supported including Kaplan-Meier weights, landmark approaches, inverse probability weighting.

Exclusion columns non-NA values excluded participants. participant_id Unique participant identifier variable. screening_exclusions List variables representing screening-stage exclusion reasons. enrollment_exclusions List variables representing enrollment-stage exclusion reasons. randomization_var Treatment arm group assignment variable randomized trials. allocation_exclusions List variables representing post-randomization exclusion reasons. followup_exclusions List variables representing follow--stage exclusion reasons. analysis_exclusions List variables representing analysis-stage exclusion reasons. show_exclusion_details Whether display detailed exclusion reasons counts. diagram_width Diagram width pixels. diagram_height Diagram height pixels. text_width Maximum characters text wraps diagram boxes. study_title Title CONSORT diagram. screening_label Custom label screening stage. enrollment_label Custom label enrollment stage. allocation_label Custom label allocation stage. followup_label Custom label follow-stage. analysis_label Custom label analysis stage. export_format Export format diagram. include_interpretation Whether include interpretation section. consort_validation Whether perform CONSORT 2010 compliance validation.

title: Correlation Network Analysis — correlationnetwork
text: Comprehensive network analysis correlation structures using multiple algorithms including  Gaussian Graphical Models (GGM), LASSO regularized networks, partial correlations.  Provides network metrics, community detection, interactive visualizations, network  comparison tests. Suitable understanding complex relationships variables network topology.

title: Correlation Network Analysis — correlationnetwork
code: correlationnetwork(   data,   vars,   group = NULL,   networkMethod = "correlation",   correlationMethod = "pearson",   threshold = 0.1,   significanceThreshold = 0.05,   onlySignificant = FALSE,   centralityMeasures = TRUE,   communityDetection = TRUE,   communityMethod = "walktrap",   networkComparison = FALSE,   plots = TRUE,   layoutAlgorithm = "spring",   nodeSize = "degree",   edgeWidth = "weight",   colorNodes = TRUE,   interactive = FALSE,   report = TRUE )

title: Correlation Network Analysis — correlationnetwork
text: data data data frame. vars vector strings naming variables include network analysis. group Variable split analysis network comparison. networkMethod Method constructing network: 'correlation' (default), 'partial', 'ggm', 'lasso'. correlationMethod correlation method use: 'pearson' (default), 'spearman', 'kendall'. threshold Minimum absolute correlation value include edge network (default: 0.1). significanceThreshold Alpha level edge significance testing (default: 0.05). onlySignificant FALSE (default) TRUE, show statistically significant edges. centralityMeasures TRUE (default) FALSE, calculate node centrality measures. communityDetection TRUE (default) FALSE, perform community detection analysis. communityMethod Method community detection: 'walktrap' (default), 'louvain', 'leiden', 'spinglass', 'betweenness'. networkComparison FALSE (default) TRUE, perform network comparison tests grouping variable provided. plots TRUE (default) FALSE, generate network visualization plots. layoutAlgorithm Layout algorithm network visualization: 'spring' (default), 'circle', 'nicely', 'kk', 'lgl'. nodeSize Method sizing nodes: 'constant', 'degree' (default), 'betweenness', 'closeness', 'eigenvector'. edgeWidth Method edge width: 'weight' (default) 'constant'. colorNodes TRUE (default) FALSE, color nodes detected communities. interactive FALSE (default) TRUE, generate interactive network plots. report TRUE (default) FALSE, provide natural language interpretation network analysis.

title: Co-Testing Analysis — cotest
text: Function analyzing combined results two concurrent diagnostic tests. Calculates post-test probabilities based various scenarios (either test positive, positive, negative).

title: Co-Testing Analysis — cotest
code: cotest(   test1_sens = 0.8,   test1_spec = 0.9,   test2_sens = 0.75,   test2_spec = 0.95,   indep = TRUE,   cond_dep_pos = 0.05,   cond_dep_neg = 0.05,   prevalence = 0.1,   fnote = FALSE,   fagan = FALSE,   preset = "custom" )

title: Co-Testing Analysis — cotest
text: test1_sens Sensitivity (true positive rate) Test 1. test1_spec Specificity (true negative rate) Test 1. test2_sens Sensitivity (true positive rate) Test 2. test2_spec Specificity (true negative rate) Test 2. indep Assume tests conditionally independent (default true). cond_dep_pos Conditional dependence tests subjects disease. Value 0 (independence) 1 (complete dependence). cond_dep_neg Conditional dependence tests subjects without disease. Value 0 (independence) 1 (complete dependence). prevalence Prior probability (disease prevalence population). Requires value 0.001 0.999. fnote . fagan . preset Select clinical preset use custom values. Presets load evidence-based sensitivity specificity values medical literature appropriate dependence parameters prevalence estimates.

what: Cox Proportional Hazards Model Diagnostics — coxdiagnosticsClass
title: Cox Proportional Hazards Model Diagnostics — coxdiagnosticsClass
text: Comprehensive Cox proportional hazards model diagnostic plots using ggcoxdiagnostics survminer package. module provides essential model validation tools survival analysis, including residual analysis, proportional hazards assumption testing, influence diagnostics.

title: Cox Proportional Hazards Model Diagnostics — coxdiagnosticsClass
text: Comprehensive Cox model diagnostic plots statistical tests.

title: Cox Proportional Hazards Model Diagnostics — coxdiagnosticsClass
text: module implements diagnostic capabilities requested GitHub Issue #61, providing comprehensive model validation Cox regression analysis. diagnostic plots help identify model violations, influential observations, assess overall model fit quality essential clinical research applications. Key diagnostic plot types: Martingale residuals: Detect non-linear relationships outliers Deviance residuals: Identify poorly fitted observations Score residuals: Assess influential observations Schoenfeld residuals: Test proportional hazards assumption DFBeta plots: Evaluate influence individual observations

title: Date Field Correction — datecorrection
text: Comprehensive date field correction standardization using multiple R packages (datefixR, anytime, lubridate). module handles messy date formats commonly found clinical databases: different separators, month representations, missing components, ambiguous formats. Provides standardized date outputs detailed correction reports quality assessment. Perfect clinical research data preprocessing database standardization workflows.

title: Date Field Correction — datecorrection
code: datecorrection(   data,   date_vars,   correction_method = "datefixr",   date_format = "auto",   day_impute = 1,   month_impute = 7,   handle_excel = TRUE,   timezone = "UTC",   show_correction_table = TRUE,   show_quality_assessment = TRUE,   show_format_analysis = TRUE,   show_correction_summary = TRUE,   show_interpretation = TRUE )

title: Date Field Correction — datecorrection
text: data data data frame. date_vars Variables containing date information various formats need correction standardization. Can handle character strings, numeric values, factors date representations. correction_method Method date correction. datefixR provides robust format detection, anytime offers flexible parsing, lubridate allows format specification, consensus combines methods maximum reliability. date_format Expected date format ambiguous cases. Auto-detect tries determine likely format based data patterns. day_impute Day month impute day missing (1-31). Default 1st month. value exceeds days month, last day month used. month_impute Month impute month missing (1-12). Default 7 (July). Commonly used middle-year value clinical research. handle_excel Whether convert Excel numeric date values (days since 1900-01-01). Useful data exported Excel spreadsheets. timezone Timezone output dates. Use UTC standardization, local timezone time--day information critical. show_correction_table Display detailed table showing original values, corrected values, correction status observation. show_quality_assessment Provide quality assessment including success rates, common problems, recommendations correction. show_format_analysis Analyze detected date formats patterns original data. show_correction_summary Summary statistics correction process including /comparison data quality metrics. show_interpretation Display guidance date correction methods, best practices, recommendations clinical research data.

Features automatic format detection, quality assessment, preview converted data. Perfect preparing datetime data analysis creating time-based variables.

title: DateTime Converter — datetimeconverter
code: datetimeconverter(   data,   datetime_var,   datetime_format = "auto",   timezone = "system",   preview_rows = 20,   extract_year = FALSE,   extract_month = FALSE,   extract_monthname = FALSE,   extract_day = FALSE,   extract_hour = FALSE,   extract_minute = FALSE,   extract_second = FALSE,   extract_dayname = FALSE,   extract_weeknum = FALSE,   extract_quarter = FALSE,   extract_dayofyear = FALSE,   show_quality_metrics = FALSE,   show_summary = FALSE,   show_explanations = FALSE,   show_glossary = FALSE )

title: DateTime Converter — datetimeconverter
text: data data data frame containing datetime variable convert. datetime_var Variable containing datetime information various formats. Can handle character strings, numeric values, factors datetime representations. datetime_format DateTime format specification. 'Auto-detect' attempts identify format automatically. Manual selection ensures accurate parsing specific datetime formats. timezone Timezone datetime parsing. 'System Default' uses computer's timezone. 'UTC' interprets datetimes Coordinated Universal Time. Note: Excel serial Unix epoch conversions always use UTC regardless setting. preview_rows Number rows display preview tables. Shows original values, corrected datetimes, extracted components quality checking. extract_year Extract display year component preview table. extract_month Extract display month component preview table. extract_monthname Extract display month name preview table. extract_day Extract display day component preview table. extract_hour Extract display hour component preview table. extract_minute Extract display minute component preview table. extract_second Extract display second component preview table. extract_dayname Extract display day name preview table. extract_weeknum Extract display week number preview table. extract_quarter Extract display quarter preview table. extract_dayofyear Extract display day year preview table. show_quality_metrics Display comprehensive quality metrics including parsing success rate, invalid dates, data quality warnings. show_summary Generate plain-language summary suitable copying reports clinical documentation. show_explanations Display educational content explaining function , use , interpret results. show_glossary Display definitions datetime-related terms (Excel serial dates, Unix epoch, timezones, etc.) aid interpretation.

title: Compare Medical Decision Tests — decisioncompare
text: Function comparing multiple Medical Decision Tests. Compares sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value, negative predictive value, metrics different tests golden standard. Includes statistical comparison using McNemar's test confidence intervals differences.

title: Compare Medical Decision Tests — decisioncompare
code: decisioncompare(   data,   gold,   goldPositive,   test1,   test1Positive,   test2,   test2Positive,   test3 = NULL,   test3Positive,   pp = FALSE,   pprob = 0.3,   od = FALSE,   fnote = FALSE,   ci = FALSE,   plot = FALSE,   radarplot = FALSE,   statComp = FALSE,   showSummary = FALSE,   showExplanations = FALSE,   showReportSentence = FALSE )

title: Compare Medical Decision Tests — decisioncompare
text: data data data frame. gold gold standard reference variable representing true disease status. goldPositive level indicating presence disease gold standard variable. test1 first diagnostic test variable evaluated performance. test1Positive level representing positive result Test 1. test2 second diagnostic test variable comparison analysis. test2Positive level representing positive result Test 2. test3 Optional third diagnostic test variable extended comparison analysis. test3Positive level representing positive result Test 3. pp Enable custom prior probability (prevalence) predictive value calculations. pprob Prior probability (disease prevalence community). Requires value 0.001 0.999, default 0.300. od Boolean selection whether show frequency tables. Default 'false'. fnote . ci . plot Generate comparison plot showing test performance metrics. radarplot Generate radar plot comprehensive test comparison visualization. statComp Perform statistical comparison tests (McNemar's test confidence intervals differences). showSummary Boolean show natural language summary statistical comparisons. showExplanations Boolean show explanations, glossary, educational content. showReportSentence Boolean show manuscript-ready report sentence.

title: Compare Medical Decision Tests — decisioncompare
text: results object containing: Tables can converted data frames asDF .data.frame. example: results$cTable1$asDF .data.frame(results$cTable1)

title: Compare Medical Decision Tests — decisioncompare
code: # Basic comparison of two diagnostic tests library(ClinicoPath) data('histopathology')  # Example 1: Compare imaging vs blood test performance result1 <- decisioncompare(     data = histopathology,     gold = "Golden Standart",     goldPositive = "1",     test1 = "New Test",     test1Positive = "1",     test2 = "Rater 1",     test2Positive = "1",     ci = TRUE,     plot = TRUE )  # Example 2: Three-test comparison with statistical analysis result2 <- decisioncompare(     data = histopathology,     gold = "Golden Standart",     goldPositive = "1",     test1 = "New Test",     test1Positive = "1",     test2 = "Rater 1",     test2Positive = "1",     test3 = "Rater 2",     test3Positive = "1",     statComp = TRUE,     radarplot = TRUE )  # Example 3: Using custom prevalence for clinical setting result3 <- decisioncompare(     data = histopathology,     gold = "Golden Standart",     goldPositive = "1",     test1 = "New Test",     test1Positive = "1",     test2 = "Rater 1",     test2Positive = "1",     pp = TRUE,     pprob = 0.15,  # 15\% prevalence in screening population     od = TRUE      # Show original frequency tables )

title: Decision Tree Graph for Cost-Effectiveness Analysis — decisiongraph
code: decisiongraph(   data,   treeType = "costeffectiveness",   clinicalPreset = "none",   decisions,   healthStates,   transitionProbs,   cycleLength = 1,   probabilities,   costs,   utilities,   outcomes,   layout = "horizontal",   nodeShapes = TRUE,   showProbabilities = TRUE,   showCosts = TRUE,   showUtilities = TRUE,   calculateExpectedValues = TRUE,   calculateNMB = TRUE,   willingnessToPay = 50000,   sensitivityAnalysis = FALSE,   discountRate = 0.03,   timeHorizon = 10,   nodeLabels = TRUE,   branchLabels = TRUE,   colorScheme = "medical",   summaryTable = TRUE,   tornado = FALSE,   decisionComparison = TRUE,   incrementalAnalysis = TRUE,   dominanceAnalysis = TRUE,   icer_confidence_intervals = FALSE,   probabilisticAnalysis = FALSE,   psa_advanced_outputs = FALSE,   numSimulations = 1000,   markovAdvanced = FALSE,   tunnelStates,   timeVaryingTransitions = FALSE,   ageSpecificTransitions,   chanceNodeMethod = "simple",   riskAdjustment = FALSE,   cycleCorrection = TRUE,   cohortTrace = FALSE,   cohortSize = 1000,   valueOfInformation = FALSE,   evpi_parameters,   budgetImpactAnalysis = FALSE,   targetPopulationSize = 10000,   marketPenetration = 0.5,   ceacThresholds = "0,100000,5000",   psa_distributions = "normal",   correlatedParameters = FALSE,   correlationMatrix,   performanceMode = "standard",   memoryOptimization = TRUE,   parallelProcessing = FALSE )

title: Decision Tree Graph for Cost-Effectiveness Analysis — decisiongraph
text: data data data frame containing decision tree parameters. treeType Type decision tree create. clinicalPreset Pre-configured analysis templates common clinical decision analysis scenarios. decisions Variables representing decision nodes (treatment options). healthStates Variables defining health states Markov model. transitionProbs Variables containing transition probabilities health states. cycleLength Length Markov cycle years. probabilities Variables containing probability values chance nodes. costs Variables containing cost values terminal nodes. utilities Variables containing utility/effectiveness values. outcomes Variables representing clinical outcomes. layout Layout orientation decision tree. nodeShapes Use different shapes different node types. showProbabilities Display probability values tree branches. showCosts Display cost values terminal nodes. showUtilities Display utility/effectiveness values. calculateExpectedValues Calculate display expected costs utilities. calculateNMB Calculate net monetary benefit (NMB) decision paths using threshold analysis. willingnessToPay Willingness pay threshold (cost per QALY) NMB calculations. sensitivityAnalysis Perform one-way sensitivity analysis key parameters. discountRate Annual discount rate future costs benefits. timeHorizon Time horizon analysis years. nodeLabels Display descriptive labels nodes. branchLabels Display labels tree branches. colorScheme Color scheme decision tree visualization. summaryTable Show summary table expected values cost-effectiveness ratios. tornado Create tornado diagram sensitivity analysis. decisionComparison Show comparison table NMB scores decision paths. incrementalAnalysis Perform incremental cost-effectiveness ratio (ICER) calculations. dominanceAnalysis Identify dominated extendedly dominated strategies ICER analysis. icer_confidence_intervals Calculate confidence intervals ICERs using bootstrap PSA results. probabilisticAnalysis Perform probabilistic sensitivity analysis using Monte Carlo simulation. psa_advanced_outputs Generate advanced PSA outputs (CEAC, EVPI, net benefit distributions). numSimulations Number Monte Carlo simulations probabilistic analysis. markovAdvanced Enable advanced Markov modeling features. tunnelStates Define tunnel states temporary health states. timeVaryingTransitions Allow transition probabilities change time. ageSpecificTransitions Variables defining age-specific transition rates. chanceNodeMethod Method calculating probabilities chance nodes. riskAdjustment Apply risk adjustment probabilities based patient characteristics. cycleCorrection Apply half-cycle correction accurate discounting Markov models. cohortTrace Generate cohort trace showing population distribution across health states time. cohortSize Size hypothetical cohort trace analysis budget impact modeling. valueOfInformation Perform Expected Value Perfect Information (EVPI) partial EVPI analysis. evpi_parameters Parameters partial EVPI analysis. budgetImpactAnalysis Perform budget impact analysis comparing total costs alternative strategies. targetPopulationSize Size target population budget impact calculations. marketPenetration Expected market penetration rate new intervention. ceacThresholds Cost-effectiveness acceptability curve thresholds (min,max,step). psa_distributions Default probability distribution uncertain parameters PSA. correlatedParameters Account correlations uncertain parameters PSA. correlationMatrix Variables defining correlation structure uncertain parameters. performanceMode Balance speed completeness analysis. memoryOptimization Enable memory-efficient processing large simulations. parallelProcessing Enable parallel processing faster PSA calculations.

title: Decision Panel Optimization — decisionpanel
text: data data data frame. test1 First diagnostic test variable. test1Positive positive level Test 1. test2 Second diagnostic test variable. test2Positive positive level Test 2. test3 Third diagnostic test variable (optional). test3Positive positive level Test 3. test4 Fourth diagnostic test variable (optional). test4Positive positive level Test 4. test5 Fifth diagnostic test variable (optional). test5Positive positive level Test 5. gold gold standard variable disease classification. goldPositive level gold standard variable indicates disease presence. useCosts Include cost considerations optimization process. testCosts Comma-separated costs test order selected tests. Example: "10,25,50" three tests. fpCost Cost harm associated false positive result. fnCost Cost harm associated false negative result. strategies testing strategies evaluate analysis. parallelRules Rule combining results parallel testing. customThreshold Number positive tests required overall positive result (using custom rule). maxTests Maximum number tests combine strategy. sequentialStop stop testing sequential strategies. optimizationCriteria Primary criterion optimizing test panels. panelOptimization Method building optimal test panels. minImprovement Minimum improvement performance metric required add test panel. redundancyThreshold Correlation threshold tests considered redundant. minSensitivity Minimum sensitivity constraint panel selection. minSpecificity Minimum specificity constraint panel selection. createTree Generate optimal decision tree test sequencing. treeMethod Method constructing decision tree. maxDepth Maximum depth decision tree. minSplit Minimum number observations required split node. showAllCombinations Display performance metrics possible test combinations. topN Number best-performing panels display results. compareStrategies Show comparative analysis different testing strategies. bootstrap Calculate bootstrap confidence intervals performance metrics. bootReps Number bootstrap replications confidence intervals. plotTree Display visual representation optimal decision tree. plotComparison Create comparison plots different testing strategies. plotCostEffect Create cost-effectiveness frontier plot. plotROC Display ROC curves top performing panels. prevalence Known disease prevalence (0 = use sample prevalence). crossValidate Perform k-fold cross-validation panel performance. nFolds Number folds cross-validation. seed Random seed reproducibility bootstrap cross-validation. showProgress Display progress indicators long-running operations like bootstrap cross-validation.

title: Decision Panel Optimization — decisionpanel
code: # \donttest{ # Load COVID-19 screening data data("covid_screening_data", package = "ClinicoPath")  # Basic decision panel optimization # Compare rapid antigen and PCR tests basic_panel <- decisionpanel(   data = covid_screening_data,   tests = c("rapid_antigen", "pcr"),   testLevels = "Positive,Positive",   gold = "covid_status",   goldPositive = "Positive",   strategies = "all",   optimizationCriteria = "accuracy" )  # Cost-effectiveness analysis # Include test costs and false positive/negative costs cost_panel <- decisionpanel(   data = covid_screening_data,   tests = c("rapid_antigen", "pcr", "chest_ct"),   testLevels = "Positive,Positive,Abnormal",   gold = "covid_status",   goldPositive = "Positive",   strategies = "all",   useCosts = TRUE,   testCosts = "5,50,200",   fpCost = 500,   fnCost = 5000,   optimizationCriteria = "utility" )  # Sequential testing with decision tree sequential_panel <- decisionpanel(   data = covid_screening_data,   tests = c("rapid_antigen", "pcr"),   testLevels = "Positive,Positive",   gold = "covid_status",   goldPositive = "Positive",   strategies = "sequential",   sequentialStop = "positive",   createTree = TRUE,   treeMethod = "cart" )  # Load breast cancer screening data data("breast_cancer_data", package = "ClinicoPath")  # Advanced panel with validation # Multiple tests with bootstrap confidence intervals advanced_panel <- decisionpanel(   data = breast_cancer_data,   tests = c("clinical_exam", "mammography", "ultrasound"),   testLevels = "Abnormal,BIRADS 3-5,Suspicious",   gold = "cancer_status",   goldPositive = "Cancer",   strategies = "all",   optimizationCriteria = "sensitivity",   minSensitivity = 0.90,   minSpecificity = 0.80,   bootstrap = TRUE,   bootReps = 1000,   crossValidate = TRUE,   nFolds = 5 )  # Parallel testing strategies # Compare different combination rules parallel_panel <- decisionpanel(   data = breast_cancer_data,   tests = c("clinical_exam", "mammography", "ultrasound"),   testLevels = "Abnormal,BIRADS 3-5,Suspicious",   gold = "cancer_status",   goldPositive = "Cancer",   strategies = "parallel",   parallelRules = "any",   compareStrategies = TRUE,   plotComparison = TRUE ) # }

title: Advanced Statistical Tests — desctools
text: Advanced statistical tests using functions DescTools package. Includes effect size calculations (Cohen's D), goodness--fit tests (Hosmer-Lemeshow, Anderson-Darling), agreement tests (Barnard, Breslow-Day), trend tests (Cochran-Armitage). Essential clinical research, epidemiological studies, advanced statistical analysis.

title: Advanced Statistical Tests — desctools
code: desctools(   data,   effect_size_analysis = FALSE,   group_var = NULL,   continuous_var = NULL,   pooled_sd = TRUE,   hedges_correction = FALSE,   effect_ci_level = 0.95,   goodness_of_fit = FALSE,   fitted_probs = NULL,   observed_outcomes = NULL,   hl_groups = 10,   normality_var = NULL,   categorical_tests = FALSE,   cat_var1 = NULL,   cat_var2 = NULL,   stratum_var = NULL,   ordered_exposure = NULL,   binary_outcome = NULL,   multiple_testing = "none",   show_effect_sizes = TRUE,   show_goodness_tests = TRUE,   show_categorical_tests = TRUE,   show_interpretations = TRUE )

title: Advanced Statistical Tests — desctools
text: data data data frame statistical analysis. effect_size_analysis Calculate effect sizes including Cohen's D comparing group means. Essential determining practical significance clinical studies. group_var Categorical variable defining groups effect size comparison. exactly 2 levels Cohen's D calculation. continuous_var Continuous variable effect size calculation (outcome measure). pooled_sd Use pooled standard deviation Cohen's D calculation. Recommended group variances similar. hedges_correction Apply Hedges correction small sample bias effect size calculation. effect_ci_level Confidence level effect size confidence intervals. goodness_of_fit Perform goodness fit tests including Hosmer-Lemeshow test logistic regression models normality tests. fitted_probs Fitted probabilities logistic regression model Hosmer-Lemeshow goodness fit test. observed_outcomes Observed binary outcomes (0/1) Hosmer-Lemeshow test. hl_groups Number groups Hosmer-Lemeshow test. Usually 10 groups provide good balance power stability. normality_var Continuous variable normality testing using Anderson-Darling goodness fit tests. categorical_tests Perform advanced tests categorical data including Barnard's test, Breslow-Day test, Cochran-Armitage trend test. cat_var1 First categorical variable contingency table analysis. cat_var2 Second categorical variable contingency table analysis. stratum_var Stratification variable Breslow-Day test homogeneity odds ratios across strata. ordered_exposure Ordered exposure variable Cochran-Armitage trend test. represent ordered dose exposure levels. binary_outcome Binary outcome variable Cochran-Armitage trend test. multiple_testing Method correcting p-values multiple tests performed. FDR (Benjamini-Hochberg) recommended clinical studies. show_effect_sizes Display effect size calculations including Cohen's D confidence intervals interpretation. show_goodness_tests Display goodness fit test results including Hosmer-Lemeshow normality tests. show_categorical_tests Display results advanced categorical data tests. show_interpretations Provide clinical interpretations guidelines statistical results aid medical decision making.

title: Advanced Statistical Tests — desctools
text: results object containing:

title: Advanced Statistical Tests — desctools
code: # Load example data data("histopathology") data("dca_test_data") data("BreastCancer")  # Example 1: Effect Size Analysis - Compare age between treatment groups desctools(     data = histopathology,     effect_size_analysis = TRUE,     group_var = "Group",     continuous_var = "Age",     pooled_sd = TRUE,     hedges_correction = FALSE,     effect_ci_level = 0.95 )  # Example 2: Goodness of Fit - Hosmer-Lemeshow test for model validation desctools(     data = dca_test_data,     goodness_of_fit = TRUE,     fitted_probs = "basic_model",     observed_outcomes = "cardiac_event_numeric",     hl_groups = 10 )  # Example 3: Categorical Analysis - Test for trend across tumor grades desctools(     data = histopathology,     categorical_tests = TRUE,     ordered_exposure = "Grade",     binary_outcome = "Death" )  # Example 4: Comprehensive Analysis - All three analysis types desctools(     data = histopathology,     effect_size_analysis = TRUE,     group_var = "Group",     continuous_var = "Age",     goodness_of_fit = TRUE,     normality_var = "MeasurementA",     categorical_tests = TRUE,     ordered_exposure = "Grade",     binary_outcome = "Death",     multiple_testing = "BH",     show_interpretations = TRUE )  # Example 5: Clinical Application - Biomarker validation desctools(     data = BreastCancer,     effect_size_analysis = TRUE,     group_var = "Class",     continuous_var = "Cl.thickness",     hedges_correction = TRUE,     goodness_of_fit = TRUE,     normality_var = "Cell.size",     multiple_testing = "BH" )

title: Diagnostic Performance Analysis — diagnosticperformance
text: Comprehensive diagnostic performance analysis including ROC curves, cross-validation, statistical comparison diagnostic tests. Supports single multiple biomarker evaluation robust validation methods.

code: diagnosticperformance(   data,   outcome,   outcomeLevel,   predictors,   validationMethod = "none",   cvFolds = 10,   cvRepeats = 1,   bootstrapN = 1000,   holdoutProp = 0.3,   comparisonMethod = "delong",   optimalCutoff = "youden",   costRatio = 1,   confidenceLevel = 0.95,   plotROC = TRUE,   plotPR = FALSE,   plotCalibration = FALSE,   showMetrics = TRUE,   showCutoffAnalysis = TRUE,   stratifyBy )

title: Diagnostic Performance Analysis — diagnosticperformance
text: data . outcome Binary outcome variable indicating disease/condition status (0/1 factor). outcomeLevel Level outcome variable representing positive cases (events). predictors Continuous predictor variables (biomarkers, risk scores) evaluate. validationMethod Method validating diagnostic performance avoid overfitting. cvFolds Number folds cross-validation (typically 5 10). cvRepeats Number times repeat cross-validation stable results. bootstrapN Number bootstrap samples bootstrap validation confidence intervals. holdoutProp Proportion data hold validation (0.1 0.5). comparisonMethod Statistical method comparing multiple ROC curves. optimalCutoff Method determining optimal diagnostic cutoff point. costRatio Ratio cost false positive false negative (cost-weighted cutoff). confidenceLevel Confidence level confidence intervals (0.80 0.99). plotROC . plotPR Generate precision-recall curves (useful imbalanced datasets). plotCalibration Generate calibration plots assess prediction calibration. showMetrics Show comprehensive diagnostic performance metrics table. showCutoffAnalysis Show optimal cutoff analysis sensitivity/specificity trade-offs. stratifyBy Optional variable stratified analysis (subgroup analysis).

title: Cross Table for Clinicopathological Comparisons — .escapeVariableNames
text: function generates cross tables comparing dependent variable (rows) grouping variable (columns) automatically selects hypothesis tests appropriate clinical research. output tables rendered various styles (e.g., arsenal, finalfit, gtsummary, NEJM, Lancet, hmisc) intended pathologists oncologists. addition visualizing associations, function now optionally provides exportable CSV version cross table. Performs comprehensive univariate stratified survival analysis comparing survival groups. analysis calculates person-time follow-group uses derive accurate survival estimates incidence rates account varying follow-durations across groups. Cox proportional hazards model incorporates person-time modeling hazard function, represents instantaneous event rate per unit person-time. Key Features: Kaplan-Meier survival curves multiple plot types Cox proportional hazards regression (univariate stratified) Median survival time confidence intervals Restricted Mean Survival Time (RMST) analysis Person-time analysis incidence rates Competing risks cause-specific survival Landmark analysis conditional survival Proportional hazards assumption testing Model residual diagnostics Pairwise group comparisons multiple testing correction Statistical Methods: Kaplan-Meier estimator survival probabilities Log-rank test group comparisons Cox proportional hazards model risk assessment Competing risks analysis using cumulative incidence functions RMST robust survival comparisons Visualization Options: Standard survival curves Cumulative events hazard plots KMunicate-style plots publication Log-log plots proportional hazards assessment Residual diagnostic plots Generates Venn Diagram Upset diagram selected categorical variables. function converts specified variables logical values based chosen "true" level. Two visual outputs produced: Venn diagram (via ggvenn) Upset plot (via UpSetR ComplexUpset). Additionally, summary table "true" counts variable provided. ComplexUpset features include advanced styling, statistical annotations, custom sorting, enhanced theming options publication-ready figures.

title: Cross Table for Clinicopathological Comparisons — .escapeVariableNames
text: vars set variables used dependent variables (rows). group variable (factor) used grouping variable (columns). sty string indicating desired table style. Options include: "arsenal", "finalfit", "gtsummary", "nejm", "lancet", "hmisc". excl Logical. TRUE, rows missing values excluded. cont string ("mean" "median") specify central tendency metric. pcat string ("chisq" "fisher") specify primary test. data data data frame elapsedtime Numeric variable containing survival time (time event censoring) tint Logical. Use dates calculate survival time diagnosis follow-dates dxdate Date variable diagnosis date (tint = TRUE) fudate Date variable follow-/event date (tint = TRUE) explanatory Factor variable group comparisons (e.g., treatment groups, risk categories) outcome Event indicator variable (binary: 0=censored, 1=event) factor multi-state outcomes outcomeLevel Event level using factor outcome variable dod Dead disease level (competing risks analysis) dooc Dead causes level (competing risks analysis) awd Alive disease level (competing risks analysis) awod Alive without disease level (competing risks analysis) analysistype Type survival analysis: "overall", "cause", "compete" cutp Time points survival probability estimation (comma-separated) timetypedata Date format data: "ymd", "dmy", "mdy", etc. timetypeoutput Time unit output: "days", "weeks", "months", "years" uselandmark Logical. Perform landmark analysis landmark Landmark time point conditional survival analysis pw Logical. Perform pairwise group comparisons padjustmethod Multiple testing correction method pairwise comparisons ph_cox Logical. Test proportional hazards assumption stratified_cox Logical. Use stratified Cox regression strata_variable Variable Cox model stratification rmst_analysis Logical. Calculate Restricted Mean Survival Time rmst_tau Time horizon RMST calculation (uses 75th percentile NULL) residual_diagnostics Logical. Calculate display model residuals export_survival_data Logical. Export survival estimates external analysis person_time Logical. Calculate person-time metrics incidence rates time_intervals Time intervals stratified person-time analysis rate_multiplier Multiplier incidence rates (e.g., 100 per 100 person-years) sc Logical. Display survival curve plot ce Logical. Display cumulative events plot ch Logical. Display cumulative hazard plot kmunicate Logical. Display KMunicate-style plot loglog Logical. Display log-log plot proportional hazards assessment endplot Maximum time plot x-axis ybegin_plot Minimum value plot y-axis yend_plot Maximum value plot y-axis byplot Time interval plot axis breaks multievent Logical. Use multiple event levels competing risks ci95 Logical. Display 95% confidence intervals plots risktable Logical. Display risk table survival curves censored Logical. Display censoring marks survival curves pplot Logical. Display p-value plots medianline Type median survival line: "none", "h", "v", "hv"

title: EM-Algorithm Frailty Models — emfrailty
text: Implements expectation-maximization (EM) algorithm based frailty models survival analysis. Provides efficient estimation frailty distributions variance components complex survival data unobserved heterogeneity. Supports multiple frailty distributions convergence diagnostics.

title: EM-Algorithm Frailty Models — emfrailty
code: emfrailty(   data,   elapsedtime,   outcome,   covariates,   frailty_variable,   outcomeLevel = "1",   frailty_distribution = "gamma",   estimation_method = "em",   baseline_hazard = "weibull",   ties_method = "breslow",   confidence_level = 0.95,   max_iterations = 100,   convergence_tolerance = 1e-06,   em_acceleration = FALSE,   variance_estimation = "observed_information",   bootstrap_samples = 500,   frailty_prediction = TRUE,   model_selection = FALSE,   diagnostic_plots = TRUE,   show_model_summary = TRUE,   show_coefficients = TRUE,   show_frailty_analysis = TRUE,   show_convergence = TRUE,   show_diagnostics = TRUE,   show_predictions = TRUE,   show_comparison = TRUE,   show_convergence_plots = TRUE,   show_frailty_plots = TRUE,   show_residual_plots = TRUE,   show_survival_plots = TRUE,   showSummaries = FALSE,   showExplanations = FALSE )

title: EM-Algorithm Frailty Models — emfrailty
text: data data data frame elapsedtime Survival time follow-duration variable. contain positive  numeric values representing time event censoring. outcome Event indicator variable specifying whether event interest occurred. Can coded 0/1, TRUE/FALSE, factor levels. covariates Predictor variables frailty model. Can include continuous variables, factors, interactions. included fixed effects model. frailty_variable Variable defining frailty groups (clusters). unique value represents different frailty group sharing common unobserved risk factors. outcomeLevel Specifies level outcome variable represents event interest. numeric variables, typically '1'. factors, specify appropriate level name. frailty_distribution Distribution assumed frailty terms. Gamma commonly used provides conjugate properties efficient EM estimation. estimation_method Method parameter estimation. Standard EM robust, accelerated variants may converge faster large datasets. baseline_hazard Specification baseline hazard function. Parametric forms provide efficiency non-parametric allows maximum flexibility. ties_method Method handling tied event times. Breslow fastest, Efron accurate, exact method precise computationally intensive. confidence_level Confidence level parameter confidence intervals hypothesis tests. max_iterations Maximum number EM algorithm iterations forced termination. convergence_tolerance Convergence tolerance EM algorithm. Smaller values require precise convergence may increase computation time. em_acceleration Enable acceleration methods (SQUAREM, Anderson) speed EM convergence. Recommended large datasets complex models. variance_estimation Method estimating parameter variances standard errors. Observed information common, bootstrap robust. bootstrap_samples Number bootstrap samples variance estimation bootstrap method selected. frailty_prediction Compute empirical Bayes predictions individual frailty values prediction intervals shrinkage estimates. model_selection Perform automatic model selection comparing different frailty distributions baseline hazard specifications using information criteria. diagnostic_plots Generate comprehensive diagnostic plots including convergence traces, residuals, frailty predictions, model fit assessments. show_model_summary Display comprehensive model summary sample characteristics convergence information. show_coefficients Display fixed effects coefficient estimates confidence intervals tests. show_frailty_analysis Display frailty variance estimates, distribution parameters, heterogeneity measures. show_convergence Display EM algorithm convergence diagnostics iteration history. show_diagnostics Display comprehensive model diagnostics including fit statistics residual analysis. show_predictions Display empirical Bayes frailty predictions shrinkage analysis. show_comparison Compare EM frailty model standard Cox model alternative specifications. show_convergence_plots Display EM algorithm convergence trace plots diagnostic visualizations. show_frailty_plots Display frailty distribution plots empirical Bayes prediction visualizations. show_residual_plots Display residual diagnostic plots model adequacy assessment. show_survival_plots Display survival curves stratified frailty groups predictions. showSummaries Generate comprehensive explanatory text summarizing analysis results, methodology, clinical interpretation guidelines. showExplanations Provide detailed explanations EM-algorithm frailty methodology, assumptions, advantages, interpretation guidelines.

performance) tiedScoreHandling Method handling tied predictor scores ROC calculation detectImbalance Automatically detect class imbalance recommend PRC appropriate imbalanceThreshold Ratio threshold title: Epidemiological Survival Analysis — epidemiosurvival
text: Epidemiological survival analysis population-based studies observational research. Provides specialized methods cohort survival analysis, case-cohort designs, population attributable risk calculation. Includes adjustment sampling schemes, competing mortality, population stratification. Designed epidemiological research including cancer registry studies, cohort studies, population surveillance.

title: Epidemiological Survival Analysis — epidemiosurvival
code: epidemiosurvival(   data,   time_var,   event_var,   exposure_var,   age_var,   calendar_time,   population_weights,   subcohort_indicator,   stratification_vars,   competing_events,   analysis_type = "cohort_survival",   cohort_design = "prospective",   sampling_method = "simple_random",   survival_method = "kaplan_meier",   regression_method = "cox_robust",   age_standardization = "none",   reference_population = "study_population",   age_groups = "0-49,50-59,60-69,70+",   calendar_periods = "1990-1999,2000-2009,2010-2019",   subcohort_size = 1000,   case_cohort_method = "prentice",   par_method = "levin",   confidence_level = 0.95,   cohort_life_tables = TRUE,   competing_risks_analysis = FALSE,   age_period_cohort_effects = FALSE,   population_impact_measures = FALSE,   survival_disparities = FALSE,   trend_analysis = FALSE,   excess_mortality = FALSE,   standardized_mortality_ratio = FALSE,   survival_curves = TRUE,   cumulative_incidence_plots = FALSE,   age_specific_rates = FALSE,   trend_plots = FALSE,   forest_plots = FALSE )

categories stratified analysis (comma-separated) calendar_periods Calendar period categories period analysis subcohort_size Size subcohort case-cohort analysis case_cohort_method Estimation method mortality/incidence rates trend_plots Plot survival trends calendar time forest_plots Generate forest plots subgroup analyses

title: Auto-Plot (esquisse) — esquisseauto
text: Automatically selects generates appropriate plot type based variable data types using esquisse package. Supports 40+ plot type combinations including histograms, scatter plots, box plots, violin plots, bar charts, line plots, . Perfect quick data visualization intelligent defaults.

title: Auto-Plot (esquisse) — esquisseauto
code: esquisseauto(   data,   xvar,   yvar,   colorvar,   fillvar,   sizevar,   groupvar,   facetvar,   autoGeom = TRUE,   manualGeom = "auto",   plotTheme = "minimal",   plotTitle = "",   plotSubtitle = "",   plotCaption = "",   xLabel = "",   yLabel = "",   legendTitle = "",   legendPosition = "right",   xAxisAngle = 0,   yAxisAngle = 0,   showCode = FALSE,   addSmoother = FALSE,   flipAxes = FALSE,   showInstructions = TRUE )

title: Auto-Plot (esquisse) — esquisseauto
text: data data data frame. xvar Variable x-axis. Can continuous, discrete, time-based. yvar Variable y-axis. Leave empty univariate plots (histograms, bar charts). Can continuous, discrete, time-based. colorvar Variable use coloring points/bars/lines. Creates grouped visualizations. fillvar Variable use filling bars/areas. Different color (outline). sizevar Variable use sizing points/lines. Typically continuous variables. groupvar Variable use grouping (useful line plots connect points). facetvar Variable use creating faceted (small multiple) plots. autoGeom Automatically select appropriate plot type based variable types. Disable manually choose available geoms. manualGeom Manually select plot type. used Auto-Select disabled. plotTheme Visual theme plot. plotTitle Custom title plot. Leave empty automatic title. plotSubtitle Subtitle text displayed title. Leave empty subtitle. plotCaption Caption text displayed bottom-right plot (e.g., data source, notes). xLabel Custom label x-axis. Leave empty use variable name. yLabel Custom label y-axis. Leave empty use variable name. legendTitle Custom title legend. Leave empty use variable name. legendPosition Position legend hide completely. xAxisAngle Rotation angle x-axis labels (0-90 degrees). Useful long labels. yAxisAngle Rotation angle y-axis labels (0-90 degrees). showCode Display R code generated esquisse reproducing plot. addSmoother Add smoothed trend line scatter plots. flipAxes Swap x y axes (useful horizontal bar charts). showInstructions Display helpful instructions use module.

what: Extremely Randomized Trees for Survival — extratrees
title: Extremely Randomized Trees for Survival — extratrees
text: Extremely Randomized Trees (Extra Trees) survival analysis using ranger package implementation. method extends random forests introducing additional randomization variable selection split point selection, leading increased bias reduced variance computational efficiency. algorithm particularly effective high-dimensional survival data, large datasets, scenarios requiring fast training prediction. Features include built-variable importance measures, --bag error estimation, support competing risks, excellent scalability. Ideal exploratory analysis, baseline modeling, ensemble methods survival prediction tasks.

title: Extremely Randomized Trees for Survival — extratrees
code: extratrees(   data,   time,   event,   predictors,   strata,   num_trees = 500,   mtry = "sqrt",   mtry_custom,   min_node_size = 10,   max_depth = 0,   splitrule = "extratrees",   num_random_splits = 1,   sample_fraction = 1,   replace = TRUE,   case_weights,   importance = "permutation",   scale_permutation = TRUE,   keep_inbag = FALSE,   oob_error = TRUE,   probability = FALSE,   show_forest_summary = TRUE,   show_importance = TRUE,   show_oob_predictions = FALSE,   plot_importance = TRUE,   plot_oob_error = TRUE,   plot_survival = FALSE,   plot_partial = FALSE,   regularization = 1,   alpha = 0.05,   num_threads = 0,   random_seed = 123 )

title: Extremely Randomized Trees for Survival — extratrees
text: data data data frame. time Time event variable (numeric). right-censored data,  time study entry event censoring. event Event indicator variable. survival analysis: 0 = censored, 1 = event. competing risks: 0 = censored, 1+ = different event types. predictors Variables use tree construction. Can include numeric, ordinal, nominal variables. algorithm handles mixed-type predictors efficiently. strata Optional stratification variable stratified survival analysis. Creates separate baseline hazards stratum. num_trees Number trees forest. trees generally improve stability performance increase computation time. 500-2000 typical. mtry Number variables randomly selected split. Square root total variables default. Smaller values increase randomization. mtry_custom Custom number variables per split mtry set 'custom'. 1 total number predictors. min_node_size Minimum number observations terminal nodes. Larger values create simpler trees reduce overfitting, smaller values allow complex patterns. max_depth Maximum depth trees. 0 means limit. Deep trees may overfit, shallow trees may underfit. Usually left unlimited Extra Trees. splitrule Splitting criterion. 'extratrees' uses extreme randomization, 'logrank' uses log-rank statistic, 'C' optimizes concordance index, 'maxstat' uses maximally selected rank statistics. num_random_splits Number random splits try per variable Extra Trees rule. Higher values reduce randomization may improve performance. sample_fraction Fraction observations sampled tree. Values < 1.0 create subsampled forests can improve generalization reduce computation. replace Use bootstrap sampling (replacement) tree. FALSE, uses subsampling without replacement. case_weights Optional variable containing case weights observations. Higher weights give observations influence tree construction. importance Method calculating variable importance. Permutation importance measures prediction accuracy decrease variables permuted. Impurity importance measures decrease node impurity. scale_permutation Scale permutation importance standard error. Provides stable importance measures especially correlated predictors. keep_inbag Store observations -bag tree. Required post-processing analyses increases memory usage. oob_error Calculate --bag prediction error. Provides unbiased estimate model performance without need separate validation set. probability Estimate survival probabilities instead hazard ratios. Useful risk prediction probability-based decisions. show_forest_summary Display summary statistics Extra Trees forest including OOB error, variable importance rankings, model parameters. show_importance Display detailed variable importance measures rankings statistical significance tests. show_oob_predictions Display --bag predictions model evaluation risk stratification analysis. plot_importance Create variable importance plot showing relative importance predictors confidence intervals. plot_oob_error Plot --bag error function number trees assess convergence optimal forest size. plot_survival Create Kaplan-Meier survival curves risk groups defined Extra Trees predictions statistical comparisons. plot_partial Generate partial dependence plots top variables showing marginal effects survival predictions. regularization Regularization parameter Extra Trees. Values > 1 increase randomization, values < 1 reduce . 1.0 standard Extra Trees. alpha Significance level variable importance testing confidence intervals plots. num_threads Number threads parallel computation. 0 uses available cores. Parallel computation significantly speeds training. random_seed Random seed reproducible results. Change get different random forests bootstrap samples.

title: Flexible Parametric Survival Models (Enhanced) — flexparametric
text: 🔬 ENHANCED: Comprehensive flexible parametric survival modeling combining traditional parametric distributions (Generalized Gamma, Weibull, etc.)  advanced spline-based approaches (Royston-Parmar, B-splines). Provides maximum  flexibility modeling complex hazard shapes, time-varying effects,  non-proportional hazards. ⚕️ CLINICAL USE: Model survival data standard Cox models inadequate.  Ideal cancer research, health economics, comparative effectiveness studies. 📊 KEY FEATURES: • Traditional parametric spline-based models one function • Automatic model comparison selection • Clinical interpretation parameters • Comprehensive diagnostic plots • Copy-ready report templates

title: Flexible Parametric Survival Models (Enhanced) — flexparametric
code: flexparametric(   data,   elapsedtime,   outcome,   covariates,   outcomeLevel = "1",   model_approach = "automatic",   distribution = "gengamma",   spline_type = "hazard",   spline_df = 4,   knot_placement = "quantiles",   manual_knots = "",   confidence_level = 0.95,   grouping_variable,   model_comparison = TRUE,   time_varying_effects = FALSE,   show_parameters = TRUE,   show_aic_bic = TRUE,   show_survival_plot = TRUE,   show_hazard_plot = FALSE,   show_spline_plot = FALSE,   show_diagnostics = TRUE,   show_clinical_summary = TRUE,   show_density_plot = FALSE,   plot_time_max = 0,   showSummaries = FALSE,   showExplanations = FALSE )

title: Flexible Parametric Survival Models (Enhanced) — flexparametric

what: Comprehensive Flexible Parametric Survival Models — flexrstpm2
title: Comprehensive Flexible Parametric Survival Models — flexrstpm2
text: 🔬 FLEXIBLE PARAMETRIC SURVIVAL MODELS (Royston-Parmar) ⚕️ CLINICAL USE: Model survival data smooth, flexible hazard functions can capture  complex patterns (increasing, decreasing, bathtub-shaped hazards). Better Cox models  need extrapolate beyond observed data estimate absolute risks. 📊 USE: • Cancer survival complex hazard patterns • Health economic evaluations requiring extrapolation • Time-varying treatment effects • Relative survival analysis population mortality ⚠️ REQUIREMENTS: • Minimum 30 events (preferably ≥50) • Follow-covering period interest • df>4: need ≥100 events avoid overfitting 📈 KEY OUTPUTS: • Hazard ratios clinical interpretation • Survival predictions specific time points • Model fit statistics (AIC, concordance) • Time-varying effect plots • Copy-ready clinical report sentences

title: Comprehensive Flexible Parametric Survival Models — flexrstpm2
code: flexrstpm2(   data,   elapsedtime,   outcome,   covariates,   outcomeLevel = "1",   scale = "hazard",   df = 4,   knots = "",   boundary_knots = "",   time_varying_covariates,   tvc_df = 3,   cure_fraction = FALSE,   bhazard,   group_variable,   link_function = "log",   prediction_times = "1, 2, 5, 10",   extrapolation_time = 20,   confidence_level = 0.95,   smooth_formula = "",   robust_se = FALSE,   time_ratio = FALSE,   relative_survival = FALSE,   model_comparison = TRUE,   goodness_of_fit = TRUE,   hazard_analysis = TRUE,   derivative_analysis = FALSE,   bootstrap_validation = FALSE,   bootstrap_samples = 500,   show_model_summary = TRUE,   show_coefficients_table = TRUE,   show_survival_curves = TRUE,   show_hazard_curves = TRUE,   show_time_varying_plots = FALSE,   show_model_diagnostics = TRUE,   show_residuals = FALSE,   showSummaries = FALSE,   showExplanations = FALSE )

title: Comprehensive Flexible Parametric Survival Models — flexrstpm2
text: data data data frame elapsedtime Survival time follow-duration variable outcome Event indicator variable (0/1, FALSE/TRUE, factor) covariates Covariate variables flexible parametric modeling outcomeLevel Level outcome variable indicating event occurrence scale Scale flexible parametric model df Degrees freedom baseline spline function (complexity hazard curve). Clinical guide: df=3-4 analyses, df=5-6 complex patterns. Need ≥30 events per df reliable results. knots Comma-separated knot positions (optional, overrides df) boundary_knots Comma-separated boundary knot positions (optional) time_varying_covariates Covariates time-varying effects (spline interactions) tvc_df Degrees freedom time-varying covariate effects cure_fraction Include cure fraction model bhazard Background hazard variable relative survival analysis group_variable Optional grouping variable stratified analysis link_function Link function baseline transformation prediction_times Comma-separated list time points survival predictions extrapolation_time Maximum time survival curve extrapolation confidence_level Confidence level confidence intervals smooth_formula Custom smoothing formula advanced specifications robust_se Use robust sandwich estimator standard errors time_ratio Include time ratio (acceleration factor) analysis relative_survival Perform relative survival analysis (requires background hazard) model_comparison Compare flexible parametric models standard parametric models goodness_of_fit Perform goodness fit tests model diagnostics hazard_analysis Generate hazard function estimates plots derivative_analysis Include analysis hazard function derivatives (acceleration/deceleration) bootstrap_validation Perform bootstrap validation model predictions bootstrap_samples Number bootstrap samples validation (bootstrap enabled) show_model_summary Display comprehensive model summary show_coefficients_table Display table model coefficients show_survival_curves Display fitted survival curves show_hazard_curves Display fitted hazard functions show_time_varying_plots Display time-varying covariate effect plots show_model_diagnostics Display model diagnostic plots show_residuals Display residual analysis plots showSummaries Generate natural language summaries results showExplanations Show detailed methodology explanations

title: Royston-Parmar Flexible Parametric Models Implementation — flexrstpm2Class
text: Backend implementation class Royston-Parmar flexible parametric survival models. R6 class provides comprehensive functionality flexible parametric modeling using restricted cubic splines model baseline log cumulative hazard function, allowing non-monotonic hazard functions maintaining parametric advantages.

title: Royston-Parmar Flexible Parametric Models Implementation — flexrstpm2Class
text: flexrstpm2Class implements Royston-Parmar flexible parametric models : Model Scales: Proportional hazards scale (log cumulative hazard) Proportional odds scale (log cumulative odds) Probit scale (normal distribution transformation) Flexible Modeling Features: Restricted cubic splines baseline function modeling Time-varying covariate effects spline interactions Customizable knot placement degrees freedom Cure fraction modeling long-term survivors Advanced Capabilities: Background hazard incorporation relative survival Multiple link functions transformation scales Time-dependent effects visualization Comprehensive model diagnostics validation Clinical Applications: Cancer survival modeling flexible hazard patterns Long-term follow-studies cure fractions Population-based survival analysis background mortality Treatment effect evaluation time-varying impacts

title: Friedman Test for Non-Parametric Repeated Measures — friedmantest
text: Friedman test non-parametric analysis repeated measures data continuous  ordinal outcomes. non-parametric alternative repeated measures  ANOVA normality assumptions violated. tests whether median values  differ significantly across multiple related measurements time points.

title: Generalized Pseudo-Observations — generalpseudo
text: Generalized pseudo-observations approach survival analysis, competing risks, censored data problems. method provides flexible framework analyzing survival outcomes using standard statistical methods transforming survival data pseudo-observations can analyzed conventional regression techniques. Supports various functionals including survival probabilities, cumulative incidence functions, restricted mean survival times.

title: Generalized Pseudo-Observations — generalpseudo
code: generalpseudo(   data,   elapsedtime,   outcome,   explanatory,   outcomeLevel = "1",   functional_type = "survival",   cause_specific = 1,   time_points = "12,24,60",   quantile_prob = 0.5,   rmst_tau = 60,   pseudo_method = "jackknife",   regression_type = "linear",   confidence_level = 0.95,   bootstrap_reps = 500,   clustering_var,   show_pseudo_values = FALSE,   show_model_diagnostics = TRUE,   show_comparison = FALSE,   functional_plot = TRUE,   residual_plot = FALSE,   pseudo_plot = FALSE,   showSummaries = TRUE,   showExplanations = TRUE )

title: Generalized Pseudo-Observations — generalpseudo
text: data data data frame elapsedtime Time event censoring outcome Event indicator (survival: 1 = event, 0 = censored; competing risks: 0 = censored, 1,2,... = specific causes) explanatory Explanatory variables pseudo-observation regression modeling outcomeLevel Level indicating event occurrence (survival analysis) functional_type Type functional pseudo-observation calculation cause_specific Cause interest competing risks analysis (competing events coded different integers) time_points Comma-separated list time points calculate pseudo-observations quantile_prob Probability quantile pseudo-observations (e.g., 0.5 median survival) rmst_tau Restriction time tau restricted mean survival time calculations pseudo_method Method calculating pseudo-observations regression_type Type regression model pseudo-observations confidence_level Confidence level confidence intervals bootstrap_reps Number bootstrap replications pseudo-observation calculation clustering_var Variable clustered data analysis (optional) show_pseudo_values Display calculated pseudo-observation values show_model_diagnostics Display comprehensive model diagnostic information show_comparison Compare pseudo-observation results traditional methods functional_plot Display plots estimated functionals residual_plot Display residual diagnostic plots pseudo_plot Display pseudo-observation distribution plots showSummaries Show comprehensive analysis summaries showExplanations Show detailed methodology explanations

what: Gradient Boosting for Survival Analysis — gradientboosting
title: Gradient Boosting for Survival Analysis — gradientboosting
text: Gradient Boosting survival analysis using ensemble methods combine multiple weak learners (typically shallow trees) create strong predictive models. implementation supports traditional gradient boosting (gbm) modern component-wise boosting (mboost) approaches. method particularly effective high-dimensional survival data complex non-linear relationships predictors survival outcomes. Features include automatic variable selection, handling mixed-type predictors, built-cross-validation optimal stopping, robust performance noisy data. Especially suitable biomarker discovery, prognostic modeling, complex survival prediction tasks.

title: Gradient Boosting for Survival Analysis — gradientboosting
code: gradientboosting(   data,   time,   event,   predictors,   strata,   algorithm = "mboost",   n_trees = 100,   learning_rate = 0.1,   max_depth = 3,   min_node_size = 10,   subsample = 1,   cv_folds = 5,   early_stopping = TRUE,   patience = 10,   reg_alpha = 0,   reg_lambda = 1,   variable_selection = TRUE,   importance_threshold = 0.01,   show_convergence = TRUE,   show_importance = TRUE,   show_predictions = FALSE,   plot_convergence = TRUE,   plot_importance = TRUE,   plot_partial = FALSE,   plot_survival = FALSE,   interaction_depth = 1,   bag_fraction = 0.5,   random_seed = 123 )

title: Gradient Boosting for Survival Analysis — gradientboosting
text: data data data frame. time Time event variable (numeric). right-censored data,  time study entry event censoring. event Event indicator variable. survival analysis: 0 = censored, 1 = event. competing risks: 0 = censored, 1+ = different event types. predictors Variables use boosting. Can include numeric, ordinal,  nominal variables. algorithm automatically handles mixed-type predictors performs variable selection. strata Optional stratification variable stratified survival analysis. Creates separate baseline hazards stratum. algorithm Boosting algorithm use. mboost provides component-wise boosting statistical framework, gbm offers traditional gradient boosting, xgboost provides extreme gradient boosting advanced regularization. n_trees Number boosting iterations (trees). trees can improve performance may lead overfitting. Use cross-validation determine optimal value. learning_rate Learning rate (shrinkage parameter). Lower values require trees often provide better generalization. Typical values: 0.01-0.3. max_depth Maximum depth individual trees. Shallow trees (1-6) typically sufficient boosting. Deeper trees may capture interactions increase overfitting risk. min_node_size Minimum number observations terminal nodes. Higher values create simpler trees reduce overfitting. subsample Fraction observations used tree. Values < 1.0 introduce stochasticity can improve generalization (stochastic gradient boosting). cv_folds Number folds cross-validation determine optimal number trees prevent overfitting. Set 0 disable cross-validation. early_stopping Use early stopping based cross-validation prevent overfitting. Stops training validation error stops improving. patience Number iterations without improvement early stopping. Higher values allow exploration may lead overfitting. reg_alpha L1 (Lasso) regularization parameter XGBoost. Higher values increase sparsity driving coefficients zero. reg_lambda L2 (Ridge) regularization parameter XGBoost. Higher values reduce overfitting penalizing large coefficients. variable_selection Perform automatic variable selection boosting. Variables low importance excluded final model. importance_threshold Minimum relative importance variable inclusion final model. Variables threshold excluded. show_convergence Display convergence diagnostics including training validation error curves, optimal stopping point, convergence statistics. show_importance Calculate display variable importance measures based frequency improvement splits. show_predictions Generate survival predictions risk scores training data. Useful model evaluation risk stratification. plot_convergence Plot training validation error curves showing convergence behavior optimal stopping point. plot_importance Generate variable importance plot showing relative importance predictors boosted model. plot_partial Create partial dependence plots top variables showing marginal effect survival hazard. plot_survival Plot Kaplan-Meier curves risk groups defined boosted model predictions statistical comparisons. interaction_depth Maximum order variable interactions consider. Higher values capture complex interactions increase computational complexity. bag_fraction Fraction variables randomly selected tree (gbm). Introduces randomness can improve generalization. random_seed Random seed reproducible results. Change get different random splits variable selections.

Can used X, Y variables multiple variables distribution analysis. groups Categorical variable grouping data plots. Creates different colors, shapes, panels group. blocks Variable blocking pairing observations. Used randomized block designs -comparisons. facet_var Variable creating multiple panels (facets). SD shows data spread, SEM shows precision mean, CI95 shows statistical confidence. summary_function Function used summarize data central tendency. Geometric mean useful log-scaled ratio data. color_palette Color palette plot. palettes color-blind friendly designed scientific publications. reverse_palette Reverse order colors selected palette. Useful adjusting color assignments groups. use_grafify_theme Apply grafify theme classic-style scientific plots. Provides clean, publication-ready styling. jitter_width Amount horizontal jittering data points. Helps avoid overlapping points categorical plots. transparency Transparency level data points (alpha value). Lower values make points transparent. point_size Size data points plot. line_size Thickness lines (error bars, connecting lines). log_transform Apply logarithmic transformation axes. Useful data spanning multiple orders magnitude. add_statistics Perform display statistical analysis plot. Integrates grafify's built-statistical functions. stat_method Statistical method apply. Results displayed text annotations separate output sections. posthoc_comparisons Perform post-hoc pairwise comparisons ANOVA. Uses emmeans estimated marginal means contrasts. comparison_method Method post-hoc comparisons. Pairwise compares groups, vs reference compares control group, trends test patterns. befafter_shape_var Variable defining /timepoint paired data. Used -plot types. befafter_id_var Variable identifying individual subjects experimental units. Used connect paired observations -plots. show_individual_points Display individual data points plot. Recommended transparency data exploration. show_summary_stats Display summary statistics table means, SD, SEM, sample sizes. show_model_diagnostics Display model diagnostic plots (Q-Q plots, residuals) statistical analysis performed. export_data Export processed data used plotting. Includes summary statistics model results. plot_width Width plot inches optimal display export. plot_height Height plot inches optimal display export. title_text Custom title plot. Leave empty automatic title based variables analysis type. x_label Custom label X-axis. Leave empty use variable name. y_label Custom label Y-axis. Leave empty use variable name. legend_position Position plot legend. experimental_design Type experimental design appropriate statistical analysis. Affects model specification interpretation. random_effects Variables include random effects mixed models. Typically subjects, blocks, experimental units. alpha_level Significance level statistical tests confidence intervals.

title: IHC Survival Analysis — %||%
text: Comprehensive missing data analysis multiple imputation using mice ggmice packages. function provides complete workflow analyzing missing data patterns, performing multiple imputation chained equations (MICE), evaluating imputation quality. Designed specifically clinical research applications missing data common proper handling critical valid statistical inference. Comprehensive clinical prediction model builder advanced validation performance assessment. Creates multiple logistic regression models optimized integration Decision Curve Analysis. Provides robust error handling, comprehensive validation, clinical interpretation guidance.

title: IHC Survival Analysis — %||%
text: missing data analysis function provides three main analysis types: Pattern Analysis: Explores missing data structure patterns Multiple Imputation: Performs MICE imputation convergence diagnostics Complete Analysis: Combines pattern analysis imputation Key features include: Visual tabular missing data pattern analysis Multiple imputation methods (PMM, Bayesian regression, logistic regression) Convergence diagnostics trace plots Quality evaluation comparing observed vs imputed data Flexible parameter customization Clinical research focused interpretations Common clinical applications: Data quality assessment clinical trials Missing data handling observational studies Regulatory compliance pharmaceutical research Sensitivity analysis missing data assumptions Prediction Model Builder supports multiple modeling approaches: Basic Clinical Models: Core demographic primary risk factors Enhanced Clinical Models: Extended clinical variables interactions Biomarker Models: Integration laboratory values advanced diagnostics Custom Models: User-defined variable combinations Key features include: Automatic data splitting unbiased validation Advanced missing data handling multiple imputation Comprehensive performance metrics (AUC, calibration, NRI, IDI) Cross-validation bootstrap validation Stepwise selection penalized regression Seamless integration Decision Curve Analysis Clinical risk score generation Robust error handling validation

title: IHC Survival Analysis — %||%
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Basic pattern analysis result <- missingdata(   data = clinical_data,   analysis_vars = c("age", "bmi", "biomarker"),   analysis_type = "pattern" )  # Multiple imputation result <- missingdata(   data = clinical_data,   analysis_vars = c("age", "bmi", "biomarker"),   analysis_type = "imputation",   n_imputations = 10,   imputation_method = "pmm" )  # Complete analysis result <- missingdata(   data = clinical_data,   analysis_vars = c("age", "bmi", "biomarker"),   analysis_type = "complete",   n_imputations = 5,   max_iterations = 10 ) } # }  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Basic clinical model result <- modelbuilder(   data = clinical_data,   outcome = "cardiovascular_event",   outcomePositive = "Yes",   basicPredictors = c("age", "sex", "diabetes"),   buildBasicModel = TRUE )  # Enhanced model with biomarkers result <- modelbuilder(   data = clinical_data,   outcome = "cardiovascular_event",   outcomePositive = "Yes",   biomarkerPredictors = c("age", "sex", "diabetes", "troponin"),   buildBiomarkerModel = TRUE,   crossValidation = TRUE,   splitData = TRUE ) } # }

Can categorical (frequencies) continuous (summary statistics). groups Variable containing group categories (e.g., disease groups, hospitals,  age groups, treatment arms, regions, etc.). values Numeric variable containing measurement values. NULL, frequencies summary statistics calculated data. facetby Optional variable create separate panels (e.g., gender, time point, location). statistic summary statistic display continuous variables. plottype Choose bar chart layout style. sortorder sort items chart. grouporder order groups legend bars. customgrouporder Comma-separated list group names desired order  (e.g., "Control,Mild,Moderate,Severe"). showvalues Display numeric values next bars. valueposition Position value labels relative bars. showerrorbars Display error bars continuous variables. errortype Type error bars display. showconnectors Draw lines connecting values across groups show patterns. colorscheme Color palette groups. customcolors Comma-separated hex colors group (e.g., "#1f77b4,#ff7f0e,#2ca02c"). referenceline Add horizontal reference line value (e.g., normal range limit, cutoff). referencelinelabel Label reference line. referenceband Add reference band using format "min,max" (e.g., "3.5,5.5" normal range). title Main title chart. subtitle Subtitle description chart. xlabel Label x-axis. ylabel Label y-axis. showlegend Display legend groups. legendtitle Title legend. legendposition Position legend. showstatistics Perform display statistical tests comparing groups. testtype Statistical test comparing groups. posthoc Perform pairwise post-hoc comparisons significant. padjust Method adjusting p-values multiple comparisons. decimals Number decimal places displayed values. highlightmax Emphasize highest value item. highlightmin Emphasize lowest value item. highlightgroups Comma-separated list group names highlight. gridlines Display background grid lines. aspectratio Aspect ratio plot. width Width plot inches. height Height plot inches. showTable Display summary table plot.
